name: Z-termination[demo]
description:
THE GAME CURRENTLY WORK IN PROGRESS.

Made in 46 days using PGM MV v1.0.4.2

Z-termination is action platformer game in post-apocalyptic world with Styled combat system that let players choose different strategies(sneak,fight,plan traps) to reach goals,exploration will reward players with benefits that improves the gameplay experience and make it worth it(the more you explore the better). make the right decisions or your adventure will end before you know it.

  • Styled combat system with  unlocking skills(WIP).
  • rewarding exploration(find powerful weapons,armors,power armor) to help you reach you goal.
  • Buy weapons,armors and upgrade them from shop.
  • sneak and hide from line of sigh to avoid conflict or to catch enemies unaware, or just blast down enemies.
  • Epic boss fights.
  • Different level types.

use of controller is recommended.

This game is currently in development and not all levels are complete. Demo only includes 4 levels 4 bosses. A lot of hardwork  and effort was put on making the demo have an enjoyable experience(lot of bugs fixed,added lot of stuff to show potential ) .

Basic Troubleshooting 

By: Abstract https://abstract-red-studio.itch.io/

I'm receiving an error stating that MSVCPXXX.dll is missing! What do I do?

This error is caused by not having all appropriate Visual C++ Redistributable packages installed from Microsoft. You will need to possibly reinstall these packages or manually place the suggested missing file(s) in the correct windows directory to solve the problem. Ensuring you have the distro packages from 2005 to present is required.

The official download page is here: https://www.microsoft.com/en-hk/download/details.aspx?id=30679

Note: There are unofficial sources pages that have every distro available from 2005 to present, but we won't link those here.

Help! The game is crashing to desktop when I try to run this!

This is also caused by not having all appropriate Visual C++ Redistributable packages installed from Microsoft. As suggested by the previous entry, please ensure your Visual C++ installation from Microsoft is installed and all files are in tact. Additionally, this can be caused by Windows permission related issues with write access to your local drive. If you don't know how Windows permission options work, try moving the installation to your local drive (C:\).
